intro: Myosotis pedunculata, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue or violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Myosotis pedunculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
